image.altText: Football specatators watch a game on a foggy day

props.synopsis: In the Yarriambiack Shire, 350 kilometres from Melbourne in Victoria's rural north-west, virtually all of the towns are shrinking.

title.children: A quarter of this town's population has vanished. Experts say that could be terminal

image.altText: A young girl wearing a blue uniform smiles as she sits at a desk in a classroom.

props.synopsis: The suspected murder-suicide of a mother and her daughter has raised serious questions about whether there were missed opportunities to intervene.

title.children: Clementine was a 'future leader'. Her mother is suspected of taking her life

image.altText: three men sitting at a desk

props.synopsis: Jared Kushner was a familiar face sitting beside Israel’s PM as a first-phase peace agreement was finalised. According to senior US officials, it was because he was a key player in closing the deal.

title.children: As Trump celebrates 'peace', the work of his son-in-law on Gaza comes into view

image.altText: A man with short, grey hair holds his hands in a prayer gesture while standing at a lectern flanked by a man and a woman.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Israelis have gathered in Tel Aviv, where US envoy Steve Witkoff spoke to the crowd in anticipation of the release of the remaining hostages in Gaza.

title.children: Netanyahu booed as US envoy Witkoff addresses massive rally in Tel Aviv

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi hug.

props.synopsis: Regardless of its historical defence ties to Russia, or its economic reliance on the United States, India is politically non-monogamous.

title.children: Trump points finger at Putin as US relationship with India falters

image.altText: A general view of the start of Race 27 of the Supercars Championship Bathurst 1000

props.synopsis: The Bathurst 1000 gets underway, with rain is expected on Mount Panorama to throw a spanner into the plans of the pre-race favourites. Follow live.

title.children: Pole sitters get the perfect start to hold early Bathurst 1000 lead

image.altText: Diane Keaton, wearing tinted glasses and black and white chequed top and scarf, smiles in a head-and-shouloder shot

props.synopsis: The unexpected news of Keaton's passing has been met with shock around the world, with stars remembering their time with the actor.

title.children: 'One of the greatest': Hollywood pays tribute to Diane Keaton who has died at 79

image.altText: Household grocery items including milk, toilet paper, instant coffee and eggs.

props.synopsis: Last month, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese invited Emirati hypermarket chain LuLu Group to compete with Coles and Woolworths for market share. But some retail experts say entry into Australia's supermarket sector isn't so simple.

title.children: A new supermarket's been invited to Australia. Here's how its prices stack up

image.altText: A man in a Richmond AFL jumper, with his face painted yellow and black, looks into a mirror.

props.synopsis: Diehard Richmond fan "Tiger Shaun" says he's watched on in horror as gambling advertising and sponsorships have come to dominate football — and become a constant reminder of the addiction he has struggled with.

title.children: 'Gambling advertising needs to go, and it needs to go now': Footy fan's plea

image.altText: A white plane wing with  red tip

props.synopsis: Hackers have released personal data from Qantas customers onto the dark web, following a cyber attack in July.

title.children: Qantas customers' data leaked to dark web after cyber attack

image.altText: A woman works on a wedding dress on a mannequin with wedding dresses on hangers behind her.

props.synopsis: Chinese Australian women are paying thousands of dollars to find love on matchmaking platforms in Australia, but behind the glossy promotions lies a different reality.

title.children: 'Why marry at all?' Woman upset at matchmaking service

image.altText: family on the beach

props.synopsis: Buyers who bought off-the-plan at a Gold Coast housing development years ago weren't just purchasing a home — they were purchasing a dream. Now, the developer is trying to cancel their contracts, but they don't want to accept that lying down.

title.children: Buyers priced out of market as developer finds sunset clause loophole

image.altText: Police vehicles parked outside a restaurant with a neon sign saying "Marmont".

props.synopsis: The men were allegedly attacked on the Yarra Promenade overnight. Police have taken five teenagers into custody.

title.children: Teens arrested after father and son allegedly stabbed in Melbourne

image.altText: An outline of a woman.

props.synopsis: The NT has Australia's highest rates of domestic and family violence, with an intimate partner homicide rate seven times the national average.

title.children: The NT has changed its response to the DV crisis. Here's how

image.altText: A young woman and an elderly woman smile at each other.

props.synopsis: Australia has 13 million spare rooms, according to a census data analysis. Could boarding be a solution to the housing crisis?

title.children: We have a lot of spare bedrooms — but boarders' rights are unclear

image.altText: Tom in a blue suit and tie with his arms crossed. He stares at the camera. The Hard Quiz Kids logo is in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Hard Quiz Kids is back. The more basic questions should be right up your alley.

title.children: Dream of trivia glory? Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: Two women sit posing for the camera wearing floral shirts and smiling.

props.synopsis: The longest-running year 12 formal for First Nations people in New South Wales proves to be an incentive for students to complete their HSC.

title.children: Two aunties' idea for year 12 celebration thrives after almost two decades

image.altText: A cat sitting on a woman's lap perched on the handlebars of a motorbike.

props.synopsis: Raised alongside working dogs, Mango isn't your average feline and comes complete with his own Facebook page, loyal followers and fan mail.

title.children: Move over muster dogs — there's a new cat in town

image.altText: Ian Watkins is jailed for 35 years for child sex offences.

props.synopsis: British media reports Ian Watkins, the disgraced former Welsh rock band Lostprophets singer who was serving a 35-year jail sentence for child sex offences, has been killed by another inmate.

title.children: UK rock singer Ian Watkins reportedly killed in prison

image.altText: an automated entry exit system display and a fingerprint scanner

props.synopsis: A new entry/exit system will require all non-European Union citizens to register their personal details, including fingerprints and facial images.

title.children: Travelling to Europe soon? You will be fingerprinted on arrival

image.altText: Supercars drive towards Mount Panorama

props.synopsis: The 2025 Bathurst 1000 starts on Sunday morning. Here's all you need to know before the 68th running of the iconic endurance race.

title.children: What time is the Bathurst 1000?

image.altText: a composite image of a dry down paddock next to a full crop of canola in bloom.

props.synopsis: After months of dust and dry skies, farmers on South Australia's Limestone Coast have welcomed early spring rain and a promising season ahead.

title.children: Once parched and bare, these paddocks are now flourishing again

image.altText: platypus swimming in water

props.synopsis: Almost 190 years on, in the place where Charles Darwin first spotted a platypus, the egg-laying mammal seems to have disappeared.

title.children: Platypus vanish from river where Charles Darwin pondered evolution

image.altText: Smiling man in cap looks at camera.

props.synopsis: From the Desert to the Seaside arts and music festival brings Western Australia's largest remote community of Bidyadanga together.

title.children: Music festival remote Indigenous community's biggest event in a decade

image.altText: The entry to a train station with a sign that says "Byford Station"

props.synopsis: More than half a billion dollars over budget, the long-awaited Byford rail extension in Perth's south-east is opening to commuters.

title.children: Final 'game changing' piece of Metronet opening in Perth's south-east

image.altText: A film still of Nick Offerman, 55, with a closely shaved head and goatee, looking panicked behind the wheel of a car.

props.synopsis: In Sovereign, Nick Offerman stars as real-life radical-right sovereign citizen Jerry Kane, who, with his son, killed two cops in Arkansas in 2010, drawing parallels to Australian fugitive Dezi Freeman.

title.children: Nick Offerman on the making of a sovereign

image.altText: A dingo on K'gari (Fraser Island) on December 18.

props.synopsis: A Queensland Ambulance Service spokesperson says the boy was treated for bites and cuts to his head near Coolooloi Creek on Saturday afternoon.

title.children: Boy flown to hospital after dingo attack on K'gari

image.altText: Car registration papers with blacked-out sections.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's West Coast Council has blamed an "administrative error" for a week-long lapse in the registration for its entire fleet of vehicles, compromising insurance.

title.children: 'Administrative error' leads to council's unregistered vehicle fleet

image.altText: A young boy holds a knitted toy octopus.

props.synopsis: More than 6,000 gifts are made each year by the charity Good Omen Goodeze. For patients like Zyan, these knitted toys are more than fun — they’re therapeutic.

title.children: When 4yo Zyan was in pain, a blue knitted octopus kept him calm

image.altText: Michael Storer smiles and holds his arms in the air while standing on the podium

props.synopsis: Perth's Michael Storer becomes the first Australian to make the Tour of Lombardy podium in 39 years, but he still can't live with the amazing Tadej Pogačar.

title.children: Storer makes Aussie cycling history but is no match for Pogačar at Il Lombardia

image.altText: Brandon Starcevich of the Lions and Callum Ah Chee of the Lions celebrate following the AFL Grand Final

props.synopsis: West Coast recruit Brandon Starcevich says he has no concerns over his history of concussions after completing a trade to the Eagles from premier Brisbane.

title.children: Starcevich 'good to go' at West Coast despite concussion concerns

image.altText: A man wearing a modified kangol hat and a brown coat has his hand up to his mouth.

props.synopsis: From the pain of racism to the joy of love, Gregory Porter's voice carries it all with power and purpose.

title.children: From racism to romance: Gregory Porter's songs hit hard

image.altText: Concept design for the new Women's and Children's Hospital at Thebarton Barracks.

props.synopsis: The Malinauskas government has become well-versed in the language of cost blowouts, and the $3.2 billion Women's and Children's Hospital is another chance for it to flex its vocabulary.

title.children: The question hanging over SA's biggest health project

image.altText: Joe Biden sitting at his office desk in the white house

props.synopsis: The spokesperson added the radiation treatment is expected to continue for five weeks and is a new stage in his level of care.

title.children: Joe Biden undergoing radiation therapy for prostate cancer

image.altText: Alyssa Healy pulls on her glove at training at the Women's Cricket World Cup.

props.synopsis: Ahead of a crucial match against World Cup host India, Australia's captain Alyssa Healy says she has faith her side's top order can turn around its recent batting struggles.

title.children: Healy backs Aussie batters to fire despite stuttering start to World Cup
